ARABIC: أَمْوَٰتٌ غَيْرُ أَحْيَآءٍ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They are dead, not alive, and they are not aware of when they will be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Dead, without life they are, and do not know when they will be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: they are dead, not living. They do not even know when they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They are not living but are dead. They can not know when they will be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They are dead, not alive; and they do not know when will the people be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (They are) dead, not alive; and they do not know when they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Dead (are they), not living, and they know not when they shall be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: dead, not alive; and are not aware when they shall be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (They are) dead, not living. And they know not when they will be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They are dead, not living; nor do they know when they will be raised to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Dead are they, not alive; and they perceive not when they will be raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They are dead and lifeless, and are not aware when they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (They are things) dead, lifeless: nor do they know when they will be raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (They are) dead, lifeless, and they know not when they will be raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They are dead, not living; and they do not know when they will be raised (to life).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They are dead, not alive; and they do not know when they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:21] They are dead, possessing no life (amwātun, ‘dead’, is a second predicate), not living (an emphasis), and they, the idols, are not aware when, is the time [in which], they shall be raised, that is, creatures: so how can they be worshipped? For, only the Creator, the Living, the Knower of the Unseen can be a God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((They are) dead) they are lifeless idols, (not living. And they know not when they) i.e. the idols (will be raised) from the graves and give account; it is also said that this means: the disbelievers do not know when they will give account for their deeds; and it is also said: the angels do not know when they will give account.
